item.title: Report X-2024061484
item.description:
Report X-2024061484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-23
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat package was sent overhead instead of placed on the IC belt. The facer did not catch it either. The person working the FLEX slide caught it and noticed that a corner of the box was damp. She called for QA over the radio. QA fetched it in a lined tote. One of four bottles leaked.

item.title: Report X-2024061399
item.description:
Report X-2024061399

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Discovered on the inbound. Package received a QA-Hazmat vision sticker. Inbound personnel set it aside for outbound. Outbound admin who first examined it noticed that it had leaked and brought it over to the damage area. Two of four bottles inside had leaked. Package left the origin unprocessed. Came from KCML 0643, bound for BRND 0564, found at MPGR 0553.

item.title: Report X-2024061230
item.description:
Report X-2024061230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE HAD A STAINED CORNER AND NOTIFIED THE DMP RESPONDER. RESPONDER RETURNED TO PROCESSING AREA AND DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP, WHICH LEAKED AND STAINED THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. BECAUSE THE CONTAINERS HAVE VENTED CAPS, THEY CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL WERE DISPOSED VIA THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024060436
item.description:
Report E-2024060436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately 2.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER discovered that R+L personnel had placed four damaged drums into one (1) 15-gallon drum. ER personnel utilized a neutralizing agent to remediate the trailer. Granular absorbents were then placed on the impacted areas and swept using hand tools. ER then broke down the impacted pallet completing remediation. All spent absorbents as well as the pallet were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.
